title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Carlton Davis praised the New England Patriots' culture and management, encouraging free agents to join the team this offseason.
Head coach Mike Vrabel and quarterback Drake Maye have improved the Patriotsâ€™ appeal by fast-tracking their rebuild.
Top 2026 free agents include George Pickens, Trey Hendrickson, and Jaelan Phillips, potential targets for the Patriots.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams ranks 8th on the list of best free-agent signings in Patriots history.
Williams signed a four-year, $104 million deal with $63 million guaranteed this past offseason.
Williams has logged 5.5 sacks and provided nine pressures in the postseason leading to Super Bowl LX.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Celtics unlikely to make major trades ahead of NBA deadline, focusing on potential roster additions.
Nets center Nic Claxton is considered a top candidate for Celtics to address big man needs.
Celtics exploring defensive options like Daniel Gafford and Yyves Missi to bolster the roster.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The second annual Something in the Way festival brings indie and alternative rock bands to Boston's Roadrunner, January 31 and February 1.
Baltimore's Angel Du$t and Las Vegas' Febuary delivered high-energy performances, exciting the crowd with stage diving and intense music.
Indie emo band Tigers Jaw announced a tour stop at The Sinclair in Cambridge as part of their upcoming album release celebration.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Bruins practiced under a tent at Raymond James Stadium to keep the ice cold before Sunday's outdoor game.
A high-tech structure with refrigeration units was used to maintain ice integrity in Florida's warm climate.
Sunday's weather is expected to be in the 30s, cooler than Tampa's usual February temperature.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands gathered in Boston Common for the 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest, demanding an end to local cooperation with ICE.
The protest, part of a national campaign, commemorated the deaths of ICU nurse Alex Pretti and Renee Good by ICE agents.
Governor Healey announced proposed legislation to prevent ICE operations in sensitive areas like churches and schools.

title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over a thousand people protested against Trump's immigration policies at Boston Common during freezing weather.
The 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest was organized by Mass 50501 and other local groups following a national shutdown.
Protestors included a brass band and featured signs with messages against Immigration and Customs Enforcement actions.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox may pursue another infielder before the 2026 season starts, prioritizing defense over power.
ESPN's Jeff Passan suggests potential targets include Isaac Paredes and Christian Walker, but no specific deals are set.
Boston is also considering options like Marcelo Mayer and a split at second base with Romy Gonzalez and David Hamilton.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots are headed to Super Bowl LX after a 14-3 season turnaround led by QB Drake Maye.
Drake Maye's performance during the regular season included a league-leading 72% completion rate and 31 touchdowns.
Mark Maye, Drake's father, expressed surprise at the Patriots' Super Bowl run after consecutive 4-13 seasons.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth will call his sixth Patriots Super Bowl in Super Bowl LX with NBC's Mike Tirico.
Collinsworth has broadcasted five Super Bowls involving the Patriots, including their last matchup with the Seahawks 11 years ago.
This season, Collinsworth covered three key Patriots games, noting their defensive strength and strategic versatility.
